channel.title: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10
channel.description:
This is a mass good-fight to many people. People that use Worldmap.BIN files might be pissed after this. I was mad after I dumped Object locations and created a method so npc's couldn't no-clip through objects(10 days of work).
I thought about this code a bit after starting my new server, The Renegade, and I actually made the code work. The client has Map data, and Models packed into the cache. Using the cache and parsing some of the incoming data(Object models) I was able to add clipping to the server.
The code took me 2 hours to make, and perfect(still am perfecting it for small bugs that you will see in the video).
Enjoy the video, my voice may sound a bit shakey cause I am still surprised that this actually worked, also it's late at night and everyone is sleeping.
Like I just said, enjoy this video:
http://www.youtube.com/v/qWSbHR6xKwI
UPDATE
Added CustomObjects.JAVA
This file uses a code that reads the cache for updates on object models. Now, you will be able to dump all objects(depending on client version) and make the clippable.
Lets say like with the tree in the video. The lesser walked through it and got stuck...
Using a few arrays and a few INT's and implementing other classes, I was able to dump the cache into two files.
Fences/Gates(objects that you can shoot through) Walls/Doors(Objects you can't shoot through...)
The code I made above works but it is server sided. So, I am now working on developing a file to dump the files into arrays
like this:
"22109", "23022", "29902", "3", "55",
ect. Yes those are actual object ID's for fences/gates. So, this is 100% but I am now working on a method to stop NPC's and players from shooting/attacking through objects.
UPDATE 2:
Finished the array's and added new definitions.
Check this video out to see what i mean, credits at end.
http://www.youtube.com/v/O0pqM0Nl-dA

item.title: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:344071”]Try this for not hitting through object.

if(Npc.isStuck == true && attackHandler.attackId != 0){
return false;
}

Just make a method so it knows when the npc can’t go through the object, and when its stuck (standing there).

Shouldn’t be too hard. But none the less great job Wolf. I didn’t know you could actually code :P[/quote]

I’ll try that for a new smart walk…and wtf? Ass hole much…I just go around un-noticed…I don’t come on here every time I develop something new…

Didn’t post on my Cannon.
Didn’t post on Pets.
Didn’t post on full Curse Prayers.
Didn’t post on Player Clipping.
Never posted on Godwars…

Only thing I have posted is mass projects.

There’s a lot I have done that no one knows about. I’m just not a huge dickhead gloater…

Read full topic
item.source: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10

item.title: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Try this for not hitting through object.

if(Npc.isStuck == true && attackHandler.attackId != 0){
return false;
}

Just make a method so it knows when the npc can’t go through the object, and when its stuck (standing there).

Shouldn’t be too hard. But none the less great job Wolf. I didn’t know you could actually code

Read full topic
item.source: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10

item.title: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:7, topic:344071”][quote author=wolfs goal link=topic=440450.msg3236261#msg3236261 date=1276491736]

Didn’t watch with sound, but its nice try making it so monsters can’t attack threw walls :D.(unless you said that… idk lol) and ye the lesser was funny.

I did say it, I added msuic just to cover up the shakeyness in my voice. I’ll probably make a better version tomorrow.

Also I started a new method for attacking through objects failure

if(isFence() && attackType != 0){
canAttack = true;
followattacker = false;
} else
if(!isFence() && attackType >=0){
canAttack = false;
followattacker = true;
}
}

I’m not sure, but this might work.

I’ll ponder on this for a bit
[/quote]

Are you going to use a different if statement for each object a monster could attack through?[/quote]

Fences and gates are classified under the same object array. If it isn’t a fence, they can’t attack through it. Maybe add a soldier with a gun and allow him to snipe through windows?

Read full topic

[/quote]

I did say it, I added msuic just to cover up the shakeyness in my voice. I’ll probably make a better version tomorrow.

Also I started a new method for attacking through objects failure

if(isFence() && attackType != 0){
canAttack = true;
followattacker = false;
} else
if(!isFence() && attackType >=0){
canAttack = false;
followattacker = true;
}
}

I’m not sure, but this might work.

I’ll ponder on this for a bit :)[/quote]

Are you going to use a different if statement for each object a monster could attack through?

item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

krackkid:

Didn’t watch with sound, but its nice try making it so monsters can’t attack threw walls :D.(unless you said that… idk lol) and ye the lesser was funny.

I did say it, I added msuic just to cover up the shakeyness in my voice. I’ll probably make a better version tomorrow.

Also I started a new method for attacking through objects failure

if(isFence() && attackType != 0){
canAttack = true;
followattacker = false;
} else
if(!isFence() && attackType >=0){
canAttack = false;
followattacker = true;
}
}

I’m not sure, but this might work.

I’ll ponder on this for a bit

item.title: NPC Clipping Client Sided[100% Clipping] Updated 6/15/10
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:2, topic:344071”]Lesser looked a little out of place though…

But nice dude, I always hated when NPC’s walked through walls because you ran away.[/quote]

I know what you mean, and like I said, I don’t have the NPC definitions file fully completed yet. It renders most monsters as 1 square in size. That is wrong, I will be fixing that and releasing this code.

Thanks for replying and the comment

Read full topic
